item.title: BP puts giant Russian joint venture up for sale
item.description: LONDON (Reuters) - BP put its half-share of its huge Russian joint venture up for sale on Friday, a bold step that would abandon nearly a third of BP's output, cut it loose from hostile partners and let the Russian state tighten its grip on the world's biggest oil industry. A sale of its half stake in TNK-BP could raise around $30 billion for BP, which would help to fund the ongoing cost of cleaning up the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil spill and allow it to invest in higher growth deals. ...

item.title: Greek radical left seeks vote to cancel bailout
item.description: The head of Greece's Radical Left Coalition, whose strong gains in last month's elections deepened concerns over his nation's economic future, vowed Friday to cancel Greece's international bailout agreement if he wins an upcoming repeat ballot.

item.title: Pope to attend La Scala concert
item.description: Pope Benedict XVI will attend a concert of Beethoven's Ninth Symphony conducted by Daniel Barenboim at La Scala on the first of three days of events focused on the family.
item.media:text: Pope Benedict XVI will attend a concert of Beethoven's Ninth Symphony conducted by Daniel Barenboim at La Scala on the first of three days of events focused on the family.

item.title: Eurozone unemployment stays at record 11 percent
item.description: Unemployment across the 17 countries that use the euro stuck at 11 percent in April — the highest level since the single currency was introduced back in 1999, piling further pressure on the region's leaders to switch from austerity to focus on stimulating growth.
item.media:text: Unemployment across the 17 countries that use the euro stuck at 11 percent in April — the highest level since the single currency was introduced back in 1999, piling further pressure on the region's leaders to switch from austerity to focus on stimulating growth.

item.title: Celebrating at French Open is normal for Nadal
item.description: Rafael Nadal has made a habit of celebrating at Roland Garros, and it's not just because his June 3 birthday falls during the French Open.
item.media:text: Rafael Nadal has made a habit of celebrating at Roland Garros, and it's not just because his June 3 birthday falls during the French Open.

item.title: Alleged Tibetan immolation photos show man ablaze
item.description: A Tibetan writer posted photos online Friday allegedly showing scenes from two self-immolations in Lhasa, the latest in a series of anti-government suicide protests but the first in the tightly guarded regional capital.
item.media:text: A Tibetan writer posted photos online Friday allegedly showing scenes from two self-immolations in Lhasa, the latest in a series of anti-government suicide protests but the first in the tightly guarded regional capital.

item.title: Wal-Mart to face scrutiny from shareholders
item.description: While Wal-Mart's U.S. business is roaring back, the world's largest retailer will face scrutiny from shareholders at its annual meeting Friday in the wake of allegations that top executives neglected their responsibility in a bribery scandal in Mexico.

item.title: AP 'napalm girl' photo from Vietnam War turns 40
item.description: In the picture, the girl will always be 9 years old and wailing "Too hot! Too hot!" as she runs down the road away from her burning Vietnamese village.
item.media:text: In the picture, the girl will always be 9 years old and wailing "Too hot! Too hot!" as she runs down the road away from her burning Vietnamese village.

item.title: 10 Things to Know for Friday
item.description: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about today (times EDT):
item.media:text: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about today (times EDT):

item.title: UK lawmakers kick up a stink over smelly restrooms
item.description: British lawmakers are kicking up a stink about the odor and lack of cleanliness inside restrooms at the House of Commons.

item.title: Poll names Anchorage residents worst-dressed
item.description: Anchorage residents are apparently not dressing to impress.
item.media:text: Anchorage residents are apparently not dressing to impress.

item.title: Pakistan 'CIA doctor' appeals conviction
item.description: Lawyers representing the Pakistani doctor jailed after helping the CIA find Osama bin Laden appealed against his conviction on Friday.
item.media:text: Lawyers representing the Pakistani doctor jailed after helping the CIA find Osama bin Laden appealed against his conviction on Friday.

item.title: Global growth concerns hit world markets
item.description: Concerns over a slowdown in the world's biggest economies hit world markets on Friday, with weak indicators out of China and Europe's financial turmoil unsettling investors ahead of a crucial U.S. jobs report.
item.media:text: Concerns over a slowdown in the world's biggest economies hit world markets on Friday, with weak indicators out of China and Europe's financial turmoil unsettling investors ahead of a crucial U.S. jobs report.

item.title: Exclusive: China arrests security official on suspicion of U.S. spying: sources
item.description: HONG KONG (Reuters) - A Chinese state security official has been arrested on suspicion of spying for the United States, sources said, a case both countries have kept quiet for several months as they strive to prevent a fresh crisis in relations. The official, an aide to a vice minister in China's security ministry, was arrested and detained early this year on allegations that he had passed information to the United States for several years on China's overseas espionage activities, said three sources, who all have direct knowledge of the matter. The aide had been recruited by the U.S. ...

item.title: Twelve executions in fresh Syria 'massacre': activists
item.description: Syrian government forces summarily executed 12 civilians on their way home from work in a fertiliser factory in Qusayr, activists in the central town told AFP by telephone on Friday.
item.media:text: Syrian government forces summarily executed 12 civilians on their way home from work in a fertiliser factory in Qusayr, activists in the central town told AFP by telephone on Friday.

item.title: Naomi Judd gets her own call-in radio show
item.description: Naomi Judd's new limited-run SiriusXM radio talk show has no safety net and even the country star says with a laugh she isn't sure that's a great idea.
item.media:text: Naomi Judd's new limited-run SiriusXM radio talk show has no safety net and even the country star says with a laugh she isn't sure that's a great idea.

item.title: Suu Kyi gets ovation at first international speech
item.description: Nobel laureate Aung San Suu Kyi basked in a long-overdue standing ovation at her first speech before an international audience Friday, but quickly shifted the focus from herself to Myanmar's many needs — and how the world can help.
item.media:text: Nobel laureate Aung San Suu Kyi basked in a long-overdue standing ovation at her first speech before an international audience Friday, but quickly shifted the focus from herself to Myanmar's many needs — and how the world can help.

item.title: Clash kills Palestinian militant, Israeli soldier
item.description: A Palestinian militant sneaked into Israel early Friday, opening fire on Israeli troops and killing one soldier, the military said. The troops fired back, killing the infiltrator in the incident that touched off fresh violence in the volatile border area, which had been mostly quiet since March.
item.media:text: A Palestinian militant sneaked into Israel early Friday, opening fire on Israeli troops and killing one soldier, the military said. The troops fired back, killing the infiltrator in the incident that touched off fresh violence in the volatile border area, which had been mostly quiet since March.

item.title: Activists: Gunmen kill 11 state workers in Syria
item.description: Gunmen killed 11 workers at a state-owned fertilizer factory in a volatile central Syrian province, activists said Friday, the second execution-style shooting reported in Syria in less than a week.
item.media:text: Gunmen killed 11 workers at a state-owned fertilizer factory in a volatile central Syrian province, activists said Friday, the second execution-style shooting reported in Syria in less than a week.

item.title: Putin heads to Berlin as Syria crisis escalates
item.description: Germany on Friday urged Russia to curb its support for Damascus, ahead of President Vladimir Putin's visit to Berlin and Paris that is set to be dominated by the escalating Syria crisis.
item.media:text: Germany on Friday urged Russia to curb its support for Damascus, ahead of President Vladimir Putin's visit to Berlin and Paris that is set to be dominated by the escalating Syria crisis.

item.title: Musicians play to set record atop Himalayan peak
item.description: Their fingers were stiff from the cold, and two musicians got altitude sickness. But the music atop a Himalayan peak in Nepal was inspired by a sensational view as the group laid claim to the record for highest musical performance.

item.title: A glance at unemployment rates around the eurozone
item.description: Unemployment in the 17 countries that use the euro remains at a record high 11 percent in April. Here is an at-a-glance guide to the unemployment rates in the individual members of the eurozone.

item.title: Liverpool hires Rodgers as new manager
item.description: New Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers conceded he'll have to earn respect at Anfield after being plucked from relative obscurity Friday following a successful spell at fellow English Premier League team Swansea.
item.media:text: New Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers conceded he'll have to earn respect at Anfield after being plucked from relative obscurity Friday following a successful spell at fellow English Premier League team Swansea.

item.title: Record-setting NM fire expected to burn for weeks
item.description: A smoky haze hangs over the rugged canyons and tree-covered expanses of southwestern New Mexico as the largest wildfire in the state's recorded history marches across more of the Gila Wilderness.
item.media:text: A smoky haze hangs over the rugged canyons and tree-covered expanses of southwestern New Mexico as the largest wildfire in the state's recorded history marches across more of the Gila Wilderness.

item.title: Irish "yes" to give euro zone scant respite
item.description: DUBLIN/ATHENS (Reuters) - Ireland was poised to announce a "yes" vote to a European budget discipline treaty on Friday, but the referendum result brings little respite to a euro zone tormented by doubts over Greece's future in the currency bloc and Spain's wobbly banks. Irish European Affairs Minister Lucinda Creighton said she was "very, very confident", based on early counts, that the fiscal pact had been passed in the only plebiscite on the treaty in the 17-nation euro area. ...
item.media:text: DUBLIN/ATHENS (Reuters) - Ireland was poised to announce a "yes" vote to a European budget discipline treaty on Friday, but the referendum result brings little respite to a euro zone tormented by doubts over Greece's future in the currency bloc and Spain's wobbly banks. Irish European Affairs Minister Lucinda Creighton said she was "very, very confident", based on early counts, that the fiscal pact had been passed in the only plebiscite on the treaty in the 17-nation euro area. ...

item.title: Jobless rate now a leading political indicator
item.description: Every four weeks between now and November, a single number issued from a spare, windowless room in the heart of the federal bureaucracy will set the battle lines for the presidential election.
item.media:text: Every four weeks between now and November, a single number issued from a spare, windowless room in the heart of the federal bureaucracy will set the battle lines for the presidential election.

item.title: Syria on brink of sectarian civil war, West says
item.description: BEIRUT (Reuters) - Syria is nearing full-blown sectarian civil war that would be catastrophic for the entire Middle East, Western nations said on Thursday, urging Russia to end its support for President Bashar al-Assad and put pressure on him to stop the bloodshed. With anti-Assad rebels urging international envoy Kofi Annan to declare his peace plan dead, freeing them from any commitment to the tattered truce, U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton said the prospect of spiraling violence presented "terrible" danger. "A civil war in a country that would be driven by sectarian divides ... ...
item.media:text: BEIRUT (Reuters) - Syria is nearing full-blown sectarian civil war that would be catastrophic for the entire Middle East, Western nations said on Thursday, urging Russia to end its support for President Bashar al-Assad and put pressure on him to stop the bloodshed. With anti-Assad rebels urging international envoy Kofi Annan to declare his peace plan dead, freeing them from any commitment to the tattered truce, U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton said the prospect of spiraling violence presented "terrible" danger. "A civil war in a country that would be driven by sectarian divides ... ...

item.title: Syria forces may face prosecution for attacks: U.N.
item.description: GENEVA (Reuters) - Syrian forces and allied "shabbiha" militia who stand accused of committing a massacre in Houla may be liable for prosecution for crimes against humanity, U.N. High Commissioner for Human Rights Navi Pillay said on Friday. Pillay, in a speech read out on her behalf to a special session of the United Nations Human Rights Council, said: "These acts may amount to crimes against humanity and other international crimes and may be indicative of a pattern of widespread or systematic attacks against civilian populations that have been perpetrated with impunity. ...

item.title: U.N. watchdog condemns Syria's widespread use of torture
item.description: GENEVA (Reuters) - Syrian forces and allied militias have tortured and mutilated civilians including children under "direct order" from Syrian authorities, the U.N. torture watchdog said on Friday. In a statement, the U.N. Committee against Torture condemned the "widespread use of torture and cruel treatment of detainees, individuals suspected of having participated in demonstrations, journalists, web bloggers, defectors of security forces, persons wounded or injured, women and children". ...

item.title: UN rights chief warns of full civil war in Syria
item.description: The U.N.'s top human rights official is calling for the international community to support the Syria peace plan and a probe into the killing of more than 100 civilians in Houla last week.
item.media:text: The U.N.'s top human rights official is calling for the international community to support the Syria peace plan and a probe into the killing of more than 100 civilians in Houla last week.

item.title: Thai politics heat up with protest at Parliament
item.description: Protesters have blocked the Thai Parliament to prevent debate on a contentious bill they fear could allow deposed ex-leader Thaksin Shinawatra to return from exile.
item.media:text: Protesters have blocked the Thai Parliament to prevent debate on a contentious bill they fear could allow deposed ex-leader Thaksin Shinawatra to return from exile.

item.title: Teen wins US spelling bee with 'guetapens'
item.description: A 14-year-old daughter of Indian immigrants clinched the 85th Scripps National Spelling Bee on Thursday by correctly spelling an obscure French word for ambush, snare or trap.
item.media:text: A 14-year-old daughter of Indian immigrants clinched the 85th Scripps National Spelling Bee on Thursday by correctly spelling an obscure French word for ambush, snare or trap.

item.title: Students in Nigeria clash with police
item.description: Police in Nigeria's largest city have used tear gas to try to disperse a crowd of several hundred university students angry at the president's decision to change the name of their school.

item.title: 'Sex history' window to pedophile priest's mind
item.description: The priest always started his favorite "game" by having the young boy remove his underwear and put on loose-fitting shorts so he could fondle him more easily. Then, the Rev. Robert Van Handel would run his hands up and down the child's body as he stretched across his lap, Walkman headphones on his ears, pretending to be asleep.
item.media:text: The priest always started his favorite "game" by having the young boy remove his underwear and put on loose-fitting shorts so he could fondle him more easily. Then, the Rev. Robert Van Handel would run his hands up and down the child's body as he stretched across his lap, Walkman headphones on his ears, pretending to be asleep.

item.title: BP considers selling its stake in TNK-BP
item.description: British oil giant BP said Friday it could sell its 50 percent stake in its Russian joint venture TNK-BP, which could fetch at least $15 billion
item.media:text: British oil giant BP said Friday it could sell its 50 percent stake in its Russian joint venture TNK-BP, which could fetch at least $15 billion

item.title: Google adds feature to help China searchers
item.description: Google has fired a new salvo in a censorship battle with Beijing by adding a feature that warns users in China who enter search keywords that might produce blocked results and suggests they try other terms.
item.media:text: Google has fired a new salvo in a censorship battle with Beijing by adding a feature that warns users in China who enter search keywords that might produce blocked results and suggests they try other terms.

item.title: Europeans want war crimes probe of Houla massacre
item.description: European diplomats were pressing Friday for the U.N.'s top human rights body to propose a war crimes probe into last week's killing of over 100 civilians in Syria, a move that would be fiercely resisted by Russia but also is viewed with misgivings by other nations such as the United States.
item.media:text: European diplomats were pressing Friday for the U.N.'s top human rights body to propose a war crimes probe into last week's killing of over 100 civilians in Syria, a move that would be fiercely resisted by Russia but also is viewed with misgivings by other nations such as the United States.

item.title: Eurozone unemployment at record 11%
item.description: Eurozone unemployment stood at a record high of 11.0 percent for the second month running in April, with Spain the hardest hit at 24.3 percent, revised official figures showed Friday.
item.media:text: Eurozone unemployment stood at a record high of 11.0 percent for the second month running in April, with Spain the hardest hit at 24.3 percent, revised official figures showed Friday.

item.title: World stocks fall as China manufacturing weakens
item.description: World stock markets fell Friday as weakness in Chinese manufacturing suggested the slowdown in the world's No. 2 economy may worsen, unsettling investors ahead of crucial U.S. employment figures.
item.media:text: World stock markets fell Friday as weakness in Chinese manufacturing suggested the slowdown in the world's No. 2 economy may worsen, unsettling investors ahead of crucial U.S. employment figures.

item.title: French police hunt Canadian body parts suspect
item.description: French police are searching for a Canadian porn actor suspected of murder and sending dismembered body parts in the mail.
